chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Anthony Stephenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:38 AM Defendant Michael Anthony Stephenson appeared by video, in custody from the Barron County Jail .  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak appeared by video for Michael Anthony Stephenson.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court addresses the DEF on appearance. DEF agrees to his zoom appearance for the plea/sentencing hearing and will notify Court with any technical issues. Court acknowledges DEF appearance by zoom. DEF has went through the plea questionnaire with Atty via phone. Plea Questionnaire submitted via electronic filing to Court. DEF advised of rights and penalties, DEF waives rights. DEF enters Guilty plea. Court acknowledges that the DEF knowingly, willingly, and intellectually has given his guilty plea. State comments on case and asks the Court follow the agreement. Atty Pollak makes comment to the court and ask Court to follow joint recommendation. Discussion follows on concurrent sentencing in revocation of 20CF169. At this time, concurrency will not take place with 20CF169 as it has not yet been sentenced. DEF gives statement to the Court. Court addresses the DEF, Court accepts the global agreement.

COURT: Count 1: Guilty - 1 Year County Jail, 174 Days Jail Credit to be applied. Fine/Costs $654.00 DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge. Concurrent 15CF140 / 17CF169.

Count 2 & 3: Dismissed but Read-In.
Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights
Defendant's Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

OFF RECORD 2:53 PM JA Karie Kennedy e-mailed JA Anna Amparo for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing to be scheduled on 10/13/22 @ 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:34 AM Judge Rod W Smeltzer appears by video from Rusk County. Defendant Michael Anthony Stephenson appeared by phone in custody from Barron County jail.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Michael Anthony Stephenson.  Motion was filed in the case.  Motion resolved without need for a hearing.  Can proceed to Arraignment today.  Enters NG plea to Felony.  Requests a status conference.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Scheduling conference on September 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
THIS CASE HAS BEEN ADMINISTRATIVELY TRANSFERRED TO JUDGE ANNETTE BARNA AS JUDGE STEVE ANDERSON HAS RETIRED.
Motion hearing on August 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:10 AM Judge Steven Anderson appears by video from Rusk County Defendant Michael Anthony Stephenson appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail, with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak appearing in person.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Atty Pollak indicates a motion to dismiss count 2.  State indicates motion has been received.  Atty Pollak makes statement on proceeding today, State responds.  Court indicates preliminary hearing will proceed, notes motion received timely and will be heard at a later date.  State indicates one witness will be called, witness in courtroom.  Court informs DEF of right to personal appearance.  DEF wishes to proceed with zoom appearances.  Court finds the DEF knowingly, intelligently, freely, and voluntarily waived his right to personal appearance.  11:14AM State calls witness, Office Dillon Saraniecki.  State questions witness.  11:21AM Clerk Gorney swears in witness.  Court verifies that all information / testimony given prior to swearing was true and correct /truthful.  Atty Pollak has no objection to prior testimony.  State continues questioning witness.  11:23AM Witness identifies DEF. State continues questioning witness.  11:23AM Atty Pollak cross examines witness. State had no redirect.   11:26AM Witness excused.  State has no additional witnesses.  Atty Pollak has no witnesses.  State makes argument, requests bind over.  Atty Pollak has no argument.  Court recognizes Atty Pollak's challenge to Count 2, Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.  Court indicates motion hearing/ARGN will be set by JA.  JA Karie Kennedy (appearing by zoom) collaborates with all parties on scheduling.  Motion hearing / ARGN set for 8/5/22 at 11:30AM.
Motion hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Motion hearing on August 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.
